info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:55AM CDT until April 19 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald and Stone.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway U, Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Flat Creek at Highway C, Butler Creek at Kings Highway and Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Pineville, Anderson, Noel, Crane, Purdy, South West City, Seligman, Exeter, Washburn, Lanagan, Shell Knob, Butterfield, Golden, Emerald Beach, Eagle Rock, Chain-O- Lakes, Arrow Point, Wayne, Ridgley, Powell, Mcdowell, Jenkins, Madry, Wheelerville, Table Rock Lake, Roaring River State Park and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Barry, MO; McDonald, MO; Stone, MO
